intro: Sida subtriloba, commonly known as the three-lobed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its structure includes a slender stem with opposite branching and small, hairy leaves. Sida subtriloba is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
